parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post mentions Carmen Nastasă, but doesn't refer to her as a parliamentary candidate or connect her to any specific party participating in the parliamentary elections.  The post focuses on her opinion regarding a cultural center, not her electoral campaign.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and includes a link to a news article. This indicates an intention to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be to share Carmen Nastasă's opinion on a matter related to a cultural center. There is no explicit or implicit call to vote for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post links to a news article, suggesting a journalistic approach to disseminating information. The content itself presents an opinion, but within the context of a news report, not as a direct appeal for votes.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>True. The post presents Carmen Nastasă's personal opinion on a specific issue. While she might be a public figure, the expression of this opinion, in itself, does not constitute electoral propaganda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3520307364780844</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while politically themed, does not violate Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on Carmen Nastasă's opinion regarding a cultural center, not on influencing the outcome of the parliamentary elections.  The post is linked to a news article, suggesting a journalistic approach rather than direct electoral campaigning.  There is no mention of any parliamentary candidate, nor any call to vote for or against any specific candidate. The paid nature of the post on a public platform does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda if the content itself does not meet the criteria for such.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Moldova Invest</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
